title: Humane has a plan for its AI-first Operating System
content:
Humane, the San Francisco startup that made headlines (and not the right kind) with its AI Pin, is making a significant move by opening up its AI-first operating system, CosmOS, for licensing. CosmOS represents a fundamental rethinking of operating systems for the AI era. While the AI Pin faced harsh criticism at launch, it served as a proving ground for CosmOS’s capabilities.

Now, with interest from major players like HP, Humane is positioning its operating system as the foundation for a new generation of AI-powered devices. The move makes strategic sense – instead of competing in the challenging hardware market, Humane can potentially power countless AI devices across industries. In an exclusive conversation Humane founders Bethany Bongiorno and Imran Chaudhri, share their plans. Read the full story on CrazyStupidTech.com.

Additional Reading: 

  • My interview with AI Computers with Imran Chaudhri.
  • The Real Personal (AI) Computer. 
  • AI Hardware is experimental, and it’s okay.
author: Om Malik
